answers.answer: Hi.The groin and armpit are predisposed to develop fungal infection because it is moist most of the time.  Prolonged intake of antibiotic also predisposes one to develop opportunistic infections like a fungal infection.Since there are several areas involved in your body, it would be best to take an oral antifungal drug as compared to a topical one.  You can try Ketoconazole tablet.  Take it after a bath/shower.  Use hypoallergenic soap also.  Do not put powder on the involved areas.Please do consult your dermatologist for proper evaluation and management.Good luck.

Hi,You need to consult your dermatologist. Since you have been taking antibacterials and antifungals for so long it would be advisable to do a repeat culture and sensitivity of the areas you mention. Discuss with your doctor and get a repeat lab test done to see if there is any persistent bacterial or fungal infection and if so which is the organism involved.The appropriate treatment can then be initiated. Till then try to keep the areas clean and dry. Also try some antiallergic medication so there is no itching.Also get your blood sugar checked to rule out diabetes. This is sometimes a cause of persistent fungal infection.Hope this helps.Good luck.
